references.paper_title: Improved algorithms for linear stochastic bandits
references.reason: This paper provides foundational algorithms for linear contextual bandits, which are extended in the current work to incorporate strategic agents.

references.paper_title: Using confidence bounds for exploitation-exploration trade-offs
references.reason: This is a seminal paper in the multi-armed bandit literature, introducing the concept of confidence bounds that are crucial for balancing exploration and exploitation, which are adapted in this work for the strategic setting.

references.paper_title: Contextual bandits with linear payoff functions
references.reason: This paper extends multi-armed bandits to contextual bandits with linear payoff functions, which forms the basis for the strategic contextual bandit problem studied here.

references.paper_title: Multi-armed bandit problems with strategic arms
references.reason: This paper is among the first to study strategic variants of the multi-armed bandit problem, introducing important concepts and techniques which are adapted and extended in this work to the contextual setting.
This is a comprehensive textbook on bandit algorithms, providing a detailed overview of the field and serving as a fundamental reference for the current work's theoretical analysis.
